Target: OntoWasteManagement is designed to represent and support the day-to-day waste management operations, ranging from handling collection requests and billing reports, meeting reporting requirements, to fleet and bin management.

Comment: General conditions for the waste services that the contracting parties agree to.
Label: Waste service commitment

Comment: A specific occurrence or instance of a waste service being performed, characterised by a particular time and context. Each event capture details such as the date, time, and/or specific actions to record and analyse individual performances for quality, efficiency, and compliance with service agreements.
Label: Waste service event

Comment: A service provided by an entity (such as a municipality or private company) that involves the collection, transportation, and disposal or recycling of waste materials from residential, commercial, or industrial sources.
Label: Waste service

Comment: A service that delivers an empty bin to the specified site.
Label: Bin delivery service

Comment: A service that delivers an empty bin to the specified site and tows away the full bin to a disposal site.
Label: Bin exchange service

Comment: A service that collects and disposes a filled garbage bin from the service site to the disposal site. The bin will not be returned to the service site afterwards.
Label: Tow away service

Comment: A service that brings an empty bin to collect and dispose of the waste on the service site.  The bin will not be returned to the service site afterwards.
Label: Touch and go service

Comment: A service that delivers an empty bin for the collection and disposal of waste on the service site, before returning the newly emptied bin to the service site .
Label: Dump and return service

Comment: A facility with waste disposal services.
Label: Waste disposal facility

Comment: A container used to carry and store waste.
Label: Bin

Comment: A bin capable of attaching to an OTC truck.
Label: Open Top Container Bin

Comment: An open top container bin with a wall height of 3 feet.
Label: 3-feet bin

Comment: An open top container bin with a wall height of 5 feet.
Label: 5-feet bin

Comment: An open top container bin with a wall height of 7 feet.
Label: 7-feet bin

Comment: An open top container bin with the ability to compact waste.
Label: Compactor bin

Comment: A vehicle with a space for carrying waste.
Label: Garbage truck

Comment: Any material, substance, or by-product that is no longer useful or required after the completion of a process. It is typically discarded because it is considered worthless, defective, or surplus to requirements.
Label: Waste

Comment: Waste produced through industrial and construction process.
Label: Industrial waste

Comment: Construction and rubble waste. For example: concrete, brick, steel rebars.
Label: Hardcore waste

Comment: Waste composed of colloids and liquids from industrial processes.
Label: Sludge waste

Comment: Waste produced by or from plants and animals.
Label: Biological waste

Comment: Waste produced from plants, usually from farming.
Label: Horticultural waste

Comment: Waste produced from tree parts, usually from tree trimming and logging activity.
Label: Tree waste

Comment: Waste composed of several waste categories.
Label: Mixed waste

Comment: Waste created from everyday activity.
Label: General waste

Comment: Waste that can be recycled.
Label: Recycled waste

Comment: Waste composed of paper-based material.
Label: Paper waste

Comment: Waste composed of metal-based material.
Label: Metal waste

Comment: Waste composed of plastic-based material.
Label: Plastic waste

Comment: Waste composed of glass-based material.
Label: Glass waste

Comment: Waste composed of electronic-based material.
Label: Electronic waste

Comment: Weight of a truck and its waste before any disposal.
Label: Gross truck weight

Comment: Weight of an empty truck after waste disposal.
Label: Unladen truck weight

Comment: Weight of the waste disposed, which is calculated through the difference of gross and unladen weight.
Label: Net waste weight

Comment: The current state of a bin.
Label: Bin status

Comment: The enumerated states belonging to the bin status: filled or empty, available or unavailable or decomissioned.
Label: Bin status enum

Comment: A relationship describing the bin type for a series of waste services.
Label: requested bin type

Comment: A relationship describing the waste category for a series of waste services.
Label: requested waste category

Comment: A relationship assigning the bin to a service.
Label: assign bin

Comment: A relationship assigning the truck to a service.
Label: assign truck

Comment: A relationship describing the disposal site for a waste service.
Label: has disposal site

Comment: A relationship describing the waste transported during a waste service.
Label: transports

Comment: A relationship describing the waste disposal charge of a disposal facility.
Label: has disposal charge

Comment: A relationship describing the waste category a disposal facility could handle.
Label: handles waste

Comment: A relationship describing the vehicle and its assigned driver.
Label: has assigned driver

Comment: A relationship describing the gross truck weight during the waste disposal procedure.
Label: has gross weight

Comment: A relationship describing the unladen truck weight during the waste disposal procedure.
Label: has unladen weight

Comment: A relationship describing the net weight of the waste collected during the service.
Label: has net weight

Comment: A relationship which describes the time of truck weight measurement with waste during a job.
Label: has measurement time

Comment: A relationship describing the current bin status.
Label: has status

Comment: An identifier for a bin.
Label: has bin number
